occupation: Rates and Credit Business Manager, Director at UBS at UBS
headline: Rates and Credit Business Manager, Director at UBS
summary: Experienced Rates & Credit Business Manager with a demonstrated history of working in the financial services industry. Strong business development professional skilled in Finance (Profit & Loss / Balancesheet), Project management and Regulatory framework.

experiences.title: Rates and Credit Business Manager, Director at UBS
experiences.description:
• Created the entire front to back framework (Controls, Regulatory and risk management) for trading Preferred stock and Exchange Traded Fund (ETF) in the Credit and Rates business
• Cost review, tracking benefits and managing of vendor services and contracts
• Representing the business at various committees, including corporate level governance and regulatory meetings (FINRA / FEDS)
• Chair the FX, Rates and Credit (FRC) Electronic Communication Network (ECN) governance forum 
• Manage the rollout of mifid requirements for the Credit business
• Build out of interim order handling solution for FRC sales and trading in the US to meet regulatory requirements and expanded to comply with mifid requirements
• Chair the weekly global Rates and Credit production meetings
• Project manage and leading of electronic trading build up for the Credit business globally
• Acting as key component of control framework and ongoing effective running of business through interaction with groups such as operational risk and engagement with supervisory processes and trading mandates 
• Acting as liaison point between business and support functions, ensuring business requirements are met and standards held 
• Meeting with vendor to implement solution and changes to the business
• Preparation of presentations for senior management committees covering global credit performance, cost and regulatory challenges
• Running and implement new business initiatives for the credit business
• Coordinating with global project managers on the implementation of regulatory
changes
• Strategizing with Desk head on budget, headcount, balance sheet utilization & cost and business planning

experiences.title: US and London Credit Product Controller
experiences.description:
• Took over as US and London Credit Product Controller and transited to New York.
• Led the offshoring project and performed training in both London and India
• Improve reporting and value added services to stakeholders, standardize process and reporting globally (US, EMEA and APAC) for the credit business
• Reviewing and managing of production analyst’s performance and work
• Substantiate P&L moves using risk and revaluation methods for explains
• Provide face off with Front office on business related issues and provide control metrics
• Interaction with various control and IT functions to ensure accurate P&L / balance sheet reporting
• Participation in UAT and validating test results on projects and firm initiatives
• Month end close analysis, disclosure and articulation of results to trading desk

experiences.title: Portfolio Management Product Controller,  Analyst
experiences.description:
• Creation of macros and simplification of manual process and spreadsheets for improved accuracy and financial reporting
• Interaction with trading and risk on trading activities, accounting and capital treatment
• Analyze all aspects of daily P&L and monitor mandate / stop loss breaches
• Understanding and substantiation of balance sheet and trading intent
• Liaise with front office on price testing results and computation of reserves 
• Reconciliation of SPV structure involving trading, operations and external parties
• Participation and discussion of new business initiatives
• Participation of IT and project developments

experiences.title: Credit Flow Product Controller and Structured Trade Reviewer, ENO
experiences.description:
• Created tools and process documents to improve knowledge and efficiency of the team and stakeholders
• Reconciliation between front office spreadsheets and the back office systems
• Perform Structured Trade Reviews ensuring economics of trades are accurate
• Analyze and providing commentary to various departments on the significant market and position contributors. 
• Manage all marketing and risk provisions on the books to ensure accurate P&L reporting
• Liaise with front office and other end users as to process development and other ad hoc queries 
• Ensuring the accuracy and integrity of revenues generated by the trading desk.

experiences.title: Director’s Assistant (Internship)
experiences.description:
Marketing and Client Management
Assisted Director in evaluation of property value and demand.
Processed potential customers’ data to Agents.
Updating of customers’ database in company’s system.
Interacting with clients to match property to demand.

education.field_of_study: Banking and Finance; Banking and Finance
education.activities_and_societies:
Business Debates Team
President of Business IT Club
